reviews.title: Easy to hold but…
reviews.content: This case was easy to put on my phone, and it feels good while holding. The red color I ordered is great, making my phone easy to spot when in my purse. But there are two weaknesses: it makes for difficulty slipping into and out of fleece jacket pockets, and it tends to pop off the edge of the phone in one particular spot. I’m happy with it for now, but I’ll look for a different brand when this one wears out.

reviews.title: Great case as long as you don't need to slip it into a pocket
reviews.content: I like everything about this case and its manufacturer, except that the silicone surface is "grippy". It's a real struggle to get the phone into a pocket (jeans, shirt, jacket, etc). I'm sure you could lay it on your dashboard, and it would stay in place, so there are use cases where it would be ideal. Another downside to the texture is it picks up dust and lint, and it's very hard to brush it off. So, I'd conditionally give this a 5 depending on whether this feature is a positive thing for you or not.

reviews.title: I’m on my 2nd Cordking silicone iPhone case
reviews.content: I do a lot of manual work and my phone gets beat up on the regular. I drop it often, step on it, etc. The case holds up shockingly well and has kept the phone looking like new underneath the case. It took me 6 months before I needed to replace it (ended up slicing the corner off somehow) which is a record. So I went and bought the exact same yellow case. Went with yellow because I misplace my phone constantly and yellow is easier to spot. And it’s a bright, solid yellow. The case is grippy and doesn’t slide on smooth surfaces and doesn’t hinder wireless charging (though it doesn’t stick well to my magnetic holder in my car). It’s a great case for the money. And when this one gets thrashed I’ll likely buy another one. For whatever all that is worth.

reviews.title: Simple yet stylish at a great price point
reviews.content: I went down the rabbit hole to find a phone case replacement. Of course, if you click on just one advertisement you shall be inundated with a myriad of options. I researched most durable cases but was not willing to pay an average $45 for a case. In my quest to look for something durable and protective yet cute enough and affordable, I came across this brand. The cases are slick, feels great to the touch, comes in every imaginable color (which are accurately reflected on Amazon) and seems to be sturdy (I hope i never have to test how protective it really is). Others have mentioned the packaging. It is worth noting the thank you message and this being a small business. They include a couple of stickers, nice touch should you feel inclined to add a little pizzaz to the case. And it comes with a lifetime warranty. The buttons are accessed easily through the case and there is minor "bulk" added. All in all, you can't beat the price of this product for what it offers.

reviews.title: Excellent case, perfect for what I want. That said, there are slight improvements that can be made
reviews.content: To summarize, this is an excellent case that you can't go wrong with. That said, read on if you are the manufacturer or a nitpicky user to know what makes this case great, what cherries it adds on top, and what slight nitpicks I have that can be improved. Pros: 1) Design is excellent. 2) Fits well, all buttons are tactile, slider is easy to access 3) protects back of the phone with a velvety layer 4) protects the back camera and front glass with a tiny lip on each side that doesn't take away from the slick feel 5) case material feels grippy and premium and don't absorb finger oils, which means you won't be constantly cleaning it 6) Works well with the magnetic charger 7) Excellent value at the price I caught it ($15) Cherries on top: 1) Made by a small manufacturer that aims to go above and beyond by offering a lifetime warranty, with a caveat (more on that in nitpicks section) 2) manufacturer adds in a sticker to cover private shipping information and a few additional stickers, which don't amount to much, but shows that the company has a nice, quirky personality. Major brownie points in terms of brand image Nitpicks: 1) The QR code provided to register the product for lifetime warranty leads to a bad gateway. I'm sure this isn't intentional, but I would like it if this can be corrected. Regardless, if for some reason I end up ruining the case, I'll just buy another one of the same type. 2) The protective lip for the screen and camera are tiny, which lends to the premium feel. However, I would like to see the screen lip be just the tiniest bit larger. This is because at the current size, it becomes flush with the screen if you add a glass screen guard (see pictures) 3) I know this would probably be hard to implement, but here in the US only, the iphone 12 is capable of 5G mm wave. This can be seen on the us model in the form of a tiny glass window beneath the power button. Although mm waves offer immense speeds, they can be obstructed by the tiniest interference. I would love to see the US model of this case have a cut out at in the case so as to reduce any chances of interference, but I'm sure none but the most premium and expensive cases will offer this feature, so I can't be mad about it. 4) I would like to see a version of this case with the added magnet on the back so people who absolutely have to use the magnetic wallet attachment feel safe using it.

reviews.title: a simple design yet effective in protection
reviews.content: I bought this case nearly a year ago and I'm still using it now, so I figured I'd make a review considering how impressed I am with how long it has held up in the account of how many times I've dropped my phone. ▸I really like how the design is pretty simple yet effective without necessarily needing to sacrifice its aesthetic. It's super easy to clean and "maintain" too. Previous phone cases I've used would show wear and tear over time until I needed to replace them eventually so aesthetics were often compromised. But this case has lasted in color, no visible dirt has accumulated or any discoloration (darkening/lightening of color) has occurred on the case in the past year. This is just a tiny nice bonus of keeping my case my favorite color. :) If I want to clean my phone to get rid of accumulated gunk in the holes, it's really easy and gentle to just remove the case without needing to wrestle with my phone like my previous cases: bullet cases, wallet cases, etc. This isn't to say the case is loose and easy to come off when unwanted though, it fits snugly on my phone and has never separated from my phone when I didn't want it to. ▸Considering how many times I've accidentally dropped my phone while hiking, the quality of the case has stayed the same over the year. There has only been one tiny abrasion on one corner of my phone case, yet my phone has still remained damage-free. I included an image of the only visible "wear and tear" over the year. Overall, I'm pretty happy with this purchase and even thought of buying a second case to switch it up when I'm bored of my light blue or whenever I'd need a replacement for my current one. I'll update my review until then.

reviews.title: Solid quality silicone case with a few drawbacks
reviews.content: I've had this case almost an entire year and finally felt the need to get a new one since I broke this one. With that being said, this was a great case for my iPhone 12 Pro. The silicone makes holding the phone extremely easy and there shouldn't be any complaints there. The build is great and it is pretty durable. It has protected my phone from several drops, both from down low and up high. I was going to buy another one, but decided against for these reasons: - I wear jeans, so putting this in my pocket (especially during the break-in phase) has always been a hassle. As time went on, it became easier but the silicone is too grippy for jeans. Not necessarily the case's fault as if you are buying a silicone case for grip (like I was) then it is doing its job in this regard, but its an annoyance nonetheless. - It can get greasy if you've got dirty hands or lay it in something because, once again, the silicone likes to hold onto stuff. - For some reason, the slot over the silent switch made switching it on/off a hassle sometimes if you didn't approach with the right angle. Overall, the case was great and I'd probably get another. It's a nice minimalist design with no branding, the interior of the case prevents the phone from being scratched by debris, and the case holds up well to the average phone drop everyone experiences. If you are going for a silicone case that's cheap and well-made, this is the one.

reviews.title: (2 mo. review) A simple case
reviews.content: I've never cared too much about the case I use as long as it wraps the phone.  I expect I might drop my phone a few times during its lifetime, and I've dropped this phone maybe once.  I don't expect the protection of a hardcover case, but it does wrap above the screen a little, so it may act as bumpers if I unfortunately drop my phone screen-faced-down.  The "bumpers" keep a low profile, so I don't suspect they would be too effective.  But any jagged edge on the ground would put the screen protector to the test, and not the case, no matter what case you had on.  So this case does its job, it's simple, easy to hold, its color is as advertised, it keeps the back glass of my phone shiny, and overall I'm pleased with this case.  Obviously I can be safe from any chippings and hopefully a cracked back-glass of my phone if and when I do drop it.  But for this price, I'm not expecting much insurance.

reviews.title: The case’s structure weakens substantially around buttons and data port
reviews.content: PROS: Soft to hold. Adds much needed friction to prevent the handset from sliding around everywhere like an air hockey puck. Fits snug to iPhone 12pro with no sight obstructions. Allows for magnetic charging through the case. Buttons are easy to depress, not too ergonomically challenging. CONS: Unlike other similar silicone/similar case designs, the structure (particularly along edges and near buttons) isn’t consistent or sturdy enough, and I’ve already found myself flicking these sections by accident when depressing buttons or ‘swipe’ across the screen, and there’s already wear-tear showing in these areas only after a couple weeks. The design would be solid if some reinforcements around these portions of the case surrounding buttons and the data port were made, such that it wasn’t constantly being stretched backwards after every app switch swipe.

reviews.title: Great budget-friendly silicone case
reviews.content: Bought this as a budget-friendly case for my iPhone 12. I immediately loved how silky smooth it feels in my hand. It’s soft and smooth but not slippery. I liked the navy color to go with my phone, though I think it could’ve been slightly brighter to match the iPhone blue. The soft suede-like part on the inside is lovely for keeping my phone encased in an added layer of protection. The buttons are easy to press. I did drop my phone several times on hard surfaces. My case did tear a bit on the edges from one drop on concrete but it kept my phone completely protected. I think the only downside to this case is the longevity, though I feel like most silicone cases have this issue. After a while, I started noticing the edges of the case rubbing off, revealing a shinier, tackier texture. This started extending to the entire case and the tackier layer kept picking up a lot of dust and lint so I got a new case from Cordking to replace my first one after less than six months. To be fair, I was wiping it down every few days with rubbing alcohol and/or  washing the outside with soap and warm water, so I wasn’t too surprised that the smooth outer layer of the case started rubbing off. My Apple silicone case had the same problem with the same treatment, though the smoothness did last a bit longer than this case. All in all happy with the product, which is why I got a second one from Cordking.

reviews.title: Like a Glove
reviews.content: So speaking of gloves, ever bought a pair of leather gloves and they felt great on the hand? You just know that the more you wear them the better they're going to feel. That's this phone case. For starters the packaging left the case well protected, with both sleeve and box. The added stickers and note provoked me to write a review. Now for the case, the felt lining is a nice touch in order to not cause any abrasions on the glossy back of the phone. I think it'll also be great for stopping moisture build up. The screen side of the case has an ever so slight lip in order to keep the screen from touching when face down. While on the back of the case uses the same idea to keep the camera lenses from doing the same. This was a major concern of mine and Cordking sidestepped that concern like a seasoned matador. The material used feels great in hand. It's visually smooth but provides a very secure grip without feeling sticky. There are cut outs for the silencing switch, charging port and perfectly lined up pin holes for the speakers. The power and volume buttons are covered but they are lined up so perfectly that the slight button protrusion allows them to be easily located and used all while causing no hinderance on the overall minimalist esthetic of the case. I could go on as I habitually go off when writing a review but put very simply... If you appreciate a minimalist, sleek and premium case on your phone, buy it you wont be disappointed.

reviews.title: Elegant, soft and protective
reviews.content: I got my phone case a few days ago. At first I was unsure about the soft feel to is as I felt like it may loosen from my grip fairly easy but that has not happened. On my phone case from my old iPhone 11 that I traded in, I had an Ohsnap grip on the back (loved it). I tried to be resourceful and reuse the grip so I carefully removed it from the old case. The grip still had so much stickiness to it so I tried to apply it to this new Cordking case but it just slipped right off and I mean right off. I figured that I could super glue it to the back (I didn't plan on removing the grip from the case, so wanted a permanent install since I liked the case look so much). I placed a very generous amount of superglue to the back of the grip, stuck it on the case and set it aside for an hour, with a 10 lb weight pushing on it. Well....it slipped RIGHT off the case....At first I was a bit frustrated seeing as how I couldn't use the grip if it wouldn't stick to the case. Then I realized, damn this case isn't dirty or damaged and just laughed at me trying to superglue this thing to it. 10/10 would recommend. It's a sleek design and thanks for the stickers !

reviews.title: Serviceable
reviews.content: The iPhone 12 is very slippery without a case. This case fits pretty well but the silicon is still pretty slippery. Hopefully it will scuff up with use. (I bought it for that reason).  Also as others have mentioned, the areas around the cutouts are weak and pull away from the phone easily (especially around the power connector).  Hopefully that won’t cause problems down the road. It is disturbing but workable.  All of the buttons work fine and the speakers still sound great. Overall a serviceable case that should last a while. For the price it’s worthwhile but there’s better out there for more money. I’m keeping it.  UPDATE:  After using for a few weeks, the silicon has become less slick and I'm upgrading from 4 to 5 stars.

reviews.title: Comparable to an Apple case but affordable
reviews.content: UPDATE: 1 year after having the case, the silicon sides started to pull apart from the hard shell. I contacted the company since the cases have a lifetime warranty and they’re sending me a new one free of charge! Amazing customer service!! FIRST REVIEW: I’ve had this case for about 5 months now and can say that it’s one of the best cases I’ve owned. I don’t drop my phone much so I can’t say how well it protects during a fall but it feels secure and has a nice slim feel to it. The inside of the case is soft and keeps the back of my phone clean and looking brand new. Most cases tend to build up dust and dirt inside but I haven’t noticed that with this case so far. It’s very easy to take off and put back on. I would prefer if it had a built in pop-socket but I added one to the case and haven’t had any issues with it. All in all I’m very satisfied with this case and think it’s comparable to the expensive Apple silicone cases but soooo much more affordable.

reviews.title: Wonderful Grip, Extremely Clean Design.
reviews.content: It's a great made case. It's design is sleek. It has a soft interior. There are no attrusive snags, raises, or design on the case nor around the sides. It doesn't look cheap in other words. There is a lip for the front screen and a great lip for the camera. You can slam this face forward or on the back with no problems. It's soft and extremely grippy. I was worried that it would collect dust or fuzzies but it hasn't at all. I used a disinfectant wipe when I first opened it and nothing has stuck to it. So if you were like me and wondering if the white case would be a dirty hassle bc you have OCD and want it clean as possible, you will be happy with this. I'm extremely picky when it comes to cases and this just kills the expensive ones I have purchased that are silicone. I'll be buying more colors. It also comes with two cute stickers and really nice professional packaging. The whole experience with this company is wonderful. They even left costumer support QR on the pamphlet. If you are struggling to find a case that is silicone, look no further :D it's not bulky what's so ever, and I can easily handle the phone * I have little feminine hands lol*. It's actually a life saver bc the original design of the phones edges do not feel comfortable for me to hold, so this case makes the phone comfortable in your hands.

reviews.title: As marketed. Good quality and value. Easy to hold
reviews.content: This is a very good case for what it is. It isn’t a super sturdy case like an otter box. But it is a slim silicone case. Pros * easy to hold. Not slippery * slim fit. Not bulky * fits iPhone 12 Pro perfectly. * soft silicone makes it easy to put cover on and off * well made. Good quality. Good value. Cons - material collects lint/dust because of static. You just have to wipe it often - it isn’t a study case compared to some other super duty ones on the market.  Just know that in advance! But it is what it is marketed as, a slim case with some protection - lens aren’t protected. This isn’t a surprise. It is as marketed. There is a raised part so lens aren’t flushed to the surface, providing some level of protection. But you may still have to find ways to protect the lens. I choose to buy another cover (in fact lesser quality!) just so the lens can be protected. You can consider lens protector/screen also but I don’t want to go that route to affect photo quality. Overall I recommend this phone cover if these are the qualities you look for: Good value. Good slim cover with light support. Easy on/off. Not slippery.

If you don't use popsockets or need anything stuck to the back for extra grip, this is a great case.

reviews.title: The exact case I was looking for!
reviews.content: This case is perfect. At first I had a big bulky otterbox on my iphone 12 pro but I have tiny hands and that made it even harder to hold so I had to get a pop socket too, which only made the whole bigger, bulkier, and heavier. After my initial new-phone paranoia wore off some, I switched to this case because a) it's prettier b) it's lighter and c) it's still easy to hold. It's super easy to get on and off and I don't feel bad about wiping it down with hand sanitizer after using my phone in stores. The only thing I was worried about is that when I plug in my phone with the case on, the plug kind of stretches the little skinny piece on the bottom front, but after several months it hasn't permanently stretched out - it always bounces back to the perfect shape when I unplug it. Overall, pretty stoked with this case. The only "con" I can think of is that since it's kind of that grippy rubber texture, it's hard to get into my purse sometimes. Then again, I have a really small purse so this wouldn't be a problem for most people haha.

reviews.title: Good mint green case
reviews.content: The case itself feels silky, and like it would provide good protection for the back of the phone and the cameras. However, the lips for the front of the phone aren’t thick enough to offer sufficient protection. You’d need to purchase a separate screen protector. The add-ons were a really nice surprise! The package, along with the phone case, comes with two stickers (small enough to put on your phone case but large enough to be easily seen), a thank-you note with free warranty, and a sticker to cover your address in case you want to take pictures. Update: The phone case got beaten up with heavy usage over the past year so I contacted the company about the warranty and they quickly replaced it! Amazing customer service. I messed up my address and realized the day it was supposed to be delivered but they rerouted it for me, which was incredibly generous of them. It delivered with the same high-quality as from a year ago, but less silky so it won't slip out of your hand as easily. Buy a case from them, you won't regret it!

reviews.title: Very similar to Apple Case for Iphone 12
reviews.content: My spouse and I both got brand new Iphone 12's this week.  We bought a Apple Case for one, and one of the Cordking Silicone Shockproof cases for the other.  Honestly they are almost identical in look and feel.  They both have the kind of high quality slick Silicone feel.  The Cordking might have slightly bigger ridges around the camera and the edges protecting the screen (which I think is a good thing) but really no difference in the overall thickness of the case (size).  Seem to be similar in drop protection (from just looking at them).  The Apple one has the Magsafe loop in it, which is supposed to help charging through the case, but honestly I don't know.  THe only cord free charge I ahve is in my car, and both cases work fine.  After seeing both, I would say that Cordking case is a MUCH better value at $15 instead of $50.  If I had it to do over, I would have bought these for both my phones.  Oh, and the cordking comes in more colors.

reviews.title: You won’t want to take it off
reviews.content: Great grip, fits snug, and it feels nicer to hold than a bare phone. Packaging was decent coming with some stickers and a well thought out thank you card. I would definitely buy it again if I decide I want another color or it gets old. If you are a minimalist like me, it doesn’t feel thick especially because of the iPhone 12’s shape. Still good for one hand use. Covers the bottom portion with some cut outs and buttons feel so natural. You wont have to look for the buttons or press it multiple times to register. The lip on the front is decent enough where you won’t have to worry about setting it in a table face first. Yes it attracts dust and pocket lint so clean your pockets once in a while do you won’t have a dusty surface every time you pull it out your pocket. I just wipe it with a paper towel and water if it is covered in dust.

reviews.title: Cute but NOT Durable
reviews.content: I originally wrote a review about how I liked this case and it was fairly durable. However, that changed after using it for a longer period of time. I had it for about a year and noticed wear and tear over that time period. I’m a college student, I’m really the only one using my phone and I dont have any kids messing with it. If you have kids that touch your phone, I would definitely not recommend this. After a few months, I noticed one of the corners start to tear. The soft silicone material of the case was very comfortable in my hand, easy to clean, and looked really nice BUT not durable. I was meaning to get a replacement once I noticed the ripping at the corners, but I kept putting it off. Now that may be my mistake, but I know a lot of people procrastinate (me being guilty myself) and would put off a replacement just like I did. Eventually my phone did fall and hit concrete. It wasn’t a huge crack, but it did crack my phone exactly on the corner that was ripping. That corner must have been super important for the hardware because my touch screen stopped working completely. Also for a side note, I did have a tempered glass screen protector on at the time of the drop.  This is definitely a cute case and I loved it while I had it. When it wasn’t ripped at the corner, it worked really well. It was the exact same color as my phone and I truly really liked it. Durability wise, it’s a big no from me. Unless you plan on replacing it every time it tears AND replacing it as soon as the tear happens, I think it’s best to look for something else. I’m not going to give this an awful review because I truly did love the case while I had it, but it will get knocked down for durability. If that’s something that’s important to you, I’d recommend a different case. Otherwise, go for it as long as you remember to replace it!

reviews.title: Best discreet case I’ve ever owned!
reviews.content: I love this phone case so much that I bought one for my husband. I am especially ecstatic because they had a neon yellow version. I can’t believe I spent $50 for the OtterBox when this amazing product is available for only $15! It makes me so angry I did not find this case first. The one thing I always look for in a case is that the lip extends beyond the phone itself so if it falls it’s more likely to land on the case first. And this has just that but still remains small and tight to the phone. Don’t waste your money at the mobile device store and just order this one. Trust me, you will not regret it!

reviews.title: Great phone case that fits snug and won’t slip out of your hands
reviews.content: I really like this phone case.  It fits my iPhone 12 perfectly and offers great protection.  It is very soft, but not slippery like some cases. I can confidently hold it without worrying its going to slip out of my hands. I tend to drop my phone 100 times per day.  It has a soft inside so it won’t scratch the back or sides of your phone.  The only thing is I wish the red color was more red.  It’s more of an orangish red.  I prefer a deeper red color.  The sound button on the side is a little difficult to switch on and off due to the design of the phone case, but not a big deal.  The cutout needs to be more centered for this.  That’s the only improvement I can see that needs to happen.
